sen.j: 宇喜多 能家（うきた よしいえ、生年不詳 - 天文 (元号)3年（1534年））は、戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Yoshi-ie UKITA (? - 1534) was a military commander during the Warring States Period in Japan.
Yoshi-ie UKITA (? - 1534) was a military commander during the Warring States Period in Japan.
Yoshiie UKITA (year of birth unknown - 1534) was a military commander during the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States)(Japan).
sen.cmt: 「生年不詳」、「戦国時代 （日本）」をそれぞれ修正しました。（用語統一）Yoshi-ie→Yoshiie と修正しました。

sen.j: 平左衛門尉とも呼ばれ、和泉国守を名乗る。
sen.e: Yoshi-ie was also called 平左衛門尉 and his name is mentioned as being Governor of Izumi Province.
Yoshi-ie was also called 平左衛門尉 and his name is mentioned as being Governor of Izumi Province.
Yoshiie was also called Hei no Saemonnojo and his name was mentioned as being Governor of Izumi Province.
sen.cmt: Yoshi-ie→Yoshiie,is→was と修正しました。スペースを修正しました。「平左衛門尉＝へいのさえもんのじょう」と確認しました。

sen.j: 宇喜多久家の子で、宇喜多興家の父、宇喜多直家の祖父。
sen.e: Yoshi-ie was a child of Hisaie UKITA father of 宇喜多興家 and grandfather of Naoie UKITA.
Yoshi-ie was a child of Hisaie UKITA father of 宇喜多興家 and grandfather of Naoie UKITA.
Yoshiie was a child of Hisaie UKITA, father of Okiie UKITA and grandfather of Naoie UKITA.
sen.cmt: Yoshi-ie→Yoshiie と修正しました。カンマを補いました。スペースを修正しました。「宇喜多興家＝うきたおきいえ」と確認しました。

sen.j: 赤松氏のもとで守護代を務めていた浦上則宗、浦上村宗に仕え、備前国豊原荘砥石城_(備前国)を領していた。
sen.e: As part of the Akamatsu clan, Yoshi-ie served Deputy Military Governors Norimune URAGAMI and Muramune URAGAMI and held territory at Toishi-jo Castlein Bizen Province.
As part of the Akamatsu clan, Yoshi-ie served Deputy Military Governors Norimune URAGAMI and Muramune URAGAMI and held territory at Toishi-jo Castlein Bizen Province.
As part of the Akamatsu clan, Yoshiie served Deputy Military Governors Norimune URAGAMI and Muramune URAGAMI and held territory at Toishi-jo Castle of Toyohara no sho Estate in Bizen Province.
sen.cmt: Yoshi-ie→Yoshiie と修正しました。スペースを修正しました。「豊原荘」を補いました。

sen.j: 孫の宇喜多直家は後に智謀家として知られるようになるが、この能家も智勇に優れた人物であり、則宗、村宗の信任が厚かった。
sen.e: Yoshi-ie`s grandchild Naoie UKITA became known for his resourcefulness however, Yoshi-ie was an individual of outstanding wisdom and courage and he enjoyed the profound trust of Norimune and Muramune.

Yoshi-ie`s grandchild Naoie UKITA became known for his resourcefulness however, Yoshi-ie was an individual of outstanding wisdom and courage and he enjoyed the profound trust of Norimune and Muramune.
Yoshiie's grandchild Naoie UKITA became known for his resourcefulness however, Yoshiie was an individual of outstanding wisdom and courage and he enjoyed the profound trust of Norimune and Muramune.
sen.cmt: Yoshi-ie→Yoshiie と修正しました。アポストロフィーを修正しました。

sen.j: 15世紀末当時、備前国は赤松氏の守護代として浦上氏が支配していた。
sen.e: At that time during the latter 15th century the Uragami clan were in control as part of the Akamatsu clan who were Shugodai (acting Military Governors) in Bizen Province.
At that time during the latter 15th century the Uragami clan were in control as part of the Akamatsu clan who were Shugodai (acting Military Governors) in Bizen Province.
At that time during the latter 15th century, the Uragami clan was ruling Bizen Province as Shugodai (acting Military Governors) of the Akamatsu clan.
sen.cmt: were→was と修正しました。文脈に応じて修正しました。

sen.j: 浦上氏の被官として、宇喜多氏の名が伺われるようになるのはこの頃のことである。
sen.e: The Ukita clan becomes known around this time as hikan (low-level bureaucrats) to the Uragami clan.
The Ukita clan becomes known around this time as hikan (low-level bureaucrats) to the Uragami clan.
The Ukita clan becomes known around this time as hikan (low-level bureaucrats) to the Uragami clan.

sen.j: しかし応仁の乱（応仁元年（1467年））に始まる戦国の世が備前にも及ぶこととなると、文明 (日本)15～16年（1483～1484年）には、「福岡 (瀬戸内市)合戦」と呼ばれる騒乱が勃発した。
sen.e: However, with the outbreak of the Onin War in 1467, Bizen Province also became entangled in the world of the Warring States and, between 1483 to 1484 there was an outbreak of fighting known as the Fukuoka (Setouchi) battles.

However, with the outbreak of the Onin War in 1467, Bizen Province also became entangled in the world of the Warring States and, between 1483 to 1484 there was an outbreak of fighting known as the Fukuoka (Setouchi) battles.

However, with the outbreak of the Onin War in 1467, Bizen Province also became entangled in the world of the Warring States and, between 1483 to 1484 there was an outbreak of fighting known as the Fukuoka (Setouchi) battles.
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。

sen.j: これは室町初期には備前守護に任じられたこともある有力国人の松田氏らが、赤松・浦上氏の備前支配を排除しようとしたことが遠因になったとされる。
sen.e: The underlying cause of the fighting was due to the powerful Matsuda clan and others (who had served as military governors early in the Muromachi Period) trying to grasp control of Bizen Province from the Akamatsu and Uragami clans.

The underlying cause of the fighting was due to the powerful Matsuda clan and others (who had served as military governors early in the Muromachi Period) trying to grasp control of Bizen Province from the Akamatsu and Uragami clans.

The underlying cause of the fighting was due to the powerful Matsuda clan and others (who had served as military governors of Bizen Province early in the Muromachi Period) trying to grasp control of Bizen Province from the Akamatsu and Uragami clans.
sen.cmt: 「備前守護」の”備前”を補いました。

sen.j: こうして浦上氏と松田氏は備前国内で勢力を争うようになった。
sen.e: The Urakami and Matsuda clans ensued in a battle for power in Bizen Province.
The Urakami and Matsuda clans ensued in a battle for power in Bizen Province.
The Uragami and Matsuda clans ensued in a battle for power in Bizen Province.
sen.cmt: Urakami→Uragami と修正しました。（「うらかみ」とも読むようですが、ここでは「うらがみ」と統一しました）

sen.j: なお1496年頃に、父である久家が宇喜多の代表として部下に宛てた書状などが存在しているが、1499年には既に宇喜多の代表は能家に代わっている。
sen.e: Then, circa 1496, Yoshi-ie`s father Hisaie became the head of the Ukita family and there are documents that address his subordinates however, responsibility as head of the family passed to somewhere along the way in 1499.

Then, circa 1496, Yoshi-ie`s father Hisaie became the head of the Ukita family and there are documents that address his subordinates however, responsibility as head of the family passed to somewhere along the way in 1499.
There are documents that Yoshiie's father Hisaie as the head of the Ukita family addressed his subordinates around in 1496 however, the family head ship has already shifted to Yoshiie in 1499.
sen.cmt: Yoshi-ie→Yoshiie と修正しました。アポストロフィーを修正しました。文脈に応じて修正しました。

sen.j: 家督相続はこの頃のことと推測される。
sen.e: It is supposed that that Yoshi-ie inherited the role of family head around this time.
It is supposed that that Yoshi-ie inherited the role of family head around this time.
It is supposed that that Yoshiie inherited the role of family head around this time.

sen.j: さらに浦上家中では家督をめぐって内訌が生じ、明応8年（1499年）には浦上則宗と浦上村国とが合戦におよんだ。
sen.e: In particular, some internal discord erupted in relation to the inheriting of the role of head of the family which resulted in Norimune URAGAMI and 浦上村国 battling each other.
In particular, some internal discord erupted in relation to the inheriting of the role of head of the family which resulted in Norimune URAGAMI and 浦上村国 battling each other.
In particular, some internal discord erupted in relation to the inheriting of the role of head of the Uragami family which resulted in Norimune URAGAMI and 村国 URAGAMI battling each other in 1499.
sen.cmt: the family→the Uragami family と修正しました。「1499年」を補いました。「村国」の読みは確認出来ておりません。

sen.j: 則宗は戦いに敗れ白旗城に篭城したが、村国の包囲で落城寸前になり、一族のものまでが則宗を見捨てて落ちのびようとするにいたった。
sen.e: Norimune lost the battle and held up in Shirahata-jo Castle which was then encircled by 村国 and, when Norimune was just on the verge of capitulating, family members abandoned Norimune in an attempt to delay the fall.

Norimune lost the battle and held up in Shirahata-jo Castle which was then encircled by 村国 and, when Norimune was just on the verge of capitulating, family members abandoned Norimune in an attempt to delay the fall.
Norimune lost the battle and held up in Shirahata-jo Castle which was then encircled by 村国 and, when Norimune was just on the verge of capitulating, family members started fleeing and abandoning him.
sen.cmt: abandoned Norimune in an attempt to delay the fall→started fleeing and abandoning him と修正しました。

sen.j: この時能家が義を説き、励ましたことで城兵は奮戦し、やがて村国は兵を引き揚げた。
sen.e: At the time, Yoshi-ie made his thoughts known and rallied the garrison to fight hard which in due course lead to 村国 withdrawing his troops.
At the time, Yoshi-ie made his thoughts known and rallied the garrison to fight hard which in due course lead to 村国 withdrawing his troops.
At the time, Yoshiie made his thoughts known and rallied the garrison to fight hard which in due course lead to 村国 withdrawing his troops.

sen.j: 文亀2年（1502年）冬、能家は浦上軍の総大将として松田勢との戦に赴き、吉井川を越えた宍甘村付近でみずから敵将・有松右京進を討ち取るなどの奮戦をした。
sen.e: In the winter of 1502 as supreme commander of the Uragami forces, Yoshi-ie engaged in battle with 松田勢 and, after crossing the Yoshii River engaged in hard fighting with and purposely killed the enemy commander 有松右京進 in the vicinity of Shijikai village..

In the winter of 1502 as supreme commander of the Uragami forces, Yoshi-ie engaged in battle with 松田勢 and, after crossing the Yoshii River engaged in hard fighting with and purposely killed the enemy commander 有松右京進 in the vicinity of Shijikai village..

In the winter of 1502 as supreme commander of the Uragami forces, Yoshiie engaged in battle with the Matsuda forces and, after crossing the Yoshiii-gawa River engaged in hard fighting with and he himself killed the enemy commander 有松右京進 in the vicinity of Shijikai village..
sen.cmt: Yoshi-ie→Yoshiie,松田勢→the Matsuda forces,Yoshii River→Yoshii-gawa River,purposely→he himself と修正しました。スペースを修正しました。「有松右京進」の読みは確認出来ておりません。

sen.j: 翌年、能家は浦上勢とともに吉井川を渡り、松田勢と雌雄を決すべく上道郡に進入した。
sen.e: The following year, Yoshi-ie together with the Uragami forces, crossed over Yoshii River and proceeded on to Kamitsu County to fight a decisive battle with the Matsuda forces.
The following year, Yoshi-ie together with the Uragami forces, crossed over Yoshii River and proceeded on to Kamitsu County to fight a decisive battle with the Matsuda forces.
The following year, Yoshiie together with the Uragami forces, crossed over Yoshii-gawa River and proceeded on to Kamitsumichi County to fight a decisive battle with the Matsuda forces.
sen.cmt: yoshi-ie→Yoshiie,Yoshii River→Yoshii-gawa River,Kamitsu→Kamitsumichi （「上道郡＝かみつみちのこおり」と確認しました） と修正しました。

sen.j: 松田元勝も自ら兵を率い御野郡笠井山に陣を定め、旭川 (岡山県)の牧石の河原で両軍は激突した。
sen.e: Motofuji MATSUDA personally lead his troops and arranged his ranks at Kasaiyama in Mino County whereupon both armies clashed on the rock-strewn river bed of the Asahi River (Okayama).
Motofuji MATSUDA personally lead his troops and arranged his ranks at Kasaiyama in Mino County whereupon both armies clashed on the rock-strewn river bed of the Asahi River (Okayama).
Motokatsu MATSUDA personally led his troops and arranged his ranks at Kasaiyama in Mino County whereupon both armies clashed on the rock-strewn river bed of the Asahi-gawa River (Okayama Prefecture).
sen.cmt: Motofuji→Motokatsu （「松田元勝＝まえだもとかつ」と確認しました）,lead→led,Asahi River→Asashi-gawa River,Okayama→Okayama Prefecture と修正しました。なお、「牧石の河原」とは固有名詞ではないかと思うのですが、確認出来ておりません。

sen.j: 松田勢は山から軍を駆けおろして浦上勢を包囲する形となったが、これを見た能家は宇喜多全軍を率いて旭川をわたり救援に向かった。
sen.e: The Matsuda forces surrounded the Uragami forces with a formation of troops streaming down from the hills however, seeing this, Yoshi-ie commanded the entire Ukita army to move reinforcements up by crossing the Asahi River.

The Matsuda forces surrounded the Uragami forces with a formation of troops streaming down from the hills however, seeing this, Yoshi-ie commanded the entire Ukita army to move reinforcements up by crossing the Asahi River.

The Matsuda forces surrounded the Uragami forces with a formation of troops streaming down from the hills however, seeing this, Yoshiie commanded the entire Ukita army to move reinforcements up by crossing the Asahi-gawa River.
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。Yohi-ie→Yoshiie,Asahi River→Asahi-gawa River と修正しました。

sen.j: 能家も兜に矢をうけ槍で突かれたがものともせず奮戦し、乱戦を制して松田勢を敗走させた。
sen.e: Yoshi-ie`s helmet was penetrated by an arrow and he was struck by lances however, he fought on defiantly and gained control of the melee which caused the Matsuda forces to take flight.
Yoshi-ie`s helmet was penetrated by an arrow and he was struck by lances however, he fought on defiantly and gained control of the melee which caused the Matsuda forces to take flight.
Yoshiie's helmet was penetrated by an arrow and he was struck by lances however, he fought on defiantly and gained control of the melee which caused the Matsuda forces to take flight.
sen.cmt: Yoshi-ie→Yoshiie と修正しました。アポストロフィーを修正しました。

sen.j: 則宗の跡を継いだ村宗であったが、自立を図る赤松義村と不和となり、永正15年（1518年）居城の三石城に退去した。
sen.e: Norimune was succeeded by Muramune however, found himself in discord with the independently minded Yoshimura AKAMATSU and, in 1518 departed the seat of the daimyo (feudal lord) at Mitsuishi-jo Castle.

Norimune was succeeded by Muramune however, found himself in discord with the independently minded Yoshimura AKAMATSU and, in 1518 departed the seat of the daimyo (feudal lord) at Mitsuishi-jo Castle.
Norimune was succeeded by Muramune however, who found himself in discord with the independently minded Yoshimura AKAMATSU and, in 1518 departed to his Mitsuishi-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: the seat of the daimyo (feudal lord) at→to his と修正しました。（「居城の三石城に退去した」としかないので）who を補いました。

sen.j: しかし義村は権力拡大の好機ととらえ、自ら兵を率い三石城に迫った。
sen.e: However, Yoshimura AKAMATSU saw this as a good opportunity to expand his powerbase, rallied his troops and marched on Mitsuishi-jo Castle.
However, Yoshimura AKAMATSU saw this as a good opportunity to expand his powerbase, rallied his troops and marched on Mitsuishi-jo Castle.
However, Yoshimura saw this as a good opportunity to expand his powerbase, rallied his troops and marched on Mitsuishi-jo Castle.

sen.j: 浦上氏にとって主筋にあたる義村の攻撃は、城中を動揺させ多くの逃亡者を出した。
sen.e: For the Urakami clan this attack by someone as close to the family as Yoshimura AKAMATSU caused a commotion within the castle and many fled.
For the Urakami clan this attack by someone as close to the family as Yoshimura AKAMATSU caused a commotion within the castle and many fled.
For the Uragami clan this attack by someone as close to the family as Yoshimura caused a commotion within the castle and many fled.
sen.cmt: Urakami→Uragami と修正しました。AKAMATSU を削除しました。

sen.j: しかし将兵の信頼を得ていた能家の活躍により赤松勢の猛攻に耐え、やがて船坂峠の戦いで赤松勢を敗走させた。
sen.e: However, Yoshi-ie actively worked to secure the trust of his men and officers and as a result, they withstood the fierce attacks of the Akamatsu forces and at length, the Akamatsu forces took flight during Battle of Funasakatoge.

However, Yoshi-ie actively worked to secure the trust of his men and officers and as a result, they withstood the fierce attacks of the Akamatsu forces and at length, the Akamatsu forces took flight during Battle of Funasakatoge.

However, Yoshiie actively worked to secure the trust of his soldiers and officers and as a result, they withstood the fierce attacks of the Akamatsu forces and at length, the Akamatsu forces took flight during the Battle of Funasakatoge.
sen.cmt: Yoshi-ie→Yoshiie,men→soldiers と修正しました。the を補いました。

sen.j: 同17年（1520年）、赤松義村は再度兵をおこし、三石城には浦上村国を、東美作国を攻略すべく小寺則職を向かわせた。
sen.e: In 1520 Yoshimura AKAMATSU raised an army again and sent Norimoto KODERA to capture Eastern Mimasaka Province and 浦上村国 in Mitsuishi-jo Castle.
In 1520 Yoshimura AKAMATSU raised an army again and sent Norimoto KODERA to capture Eastern Mimasaka Province and 浦上村国 in Mitsuishi-jo Castle.
In 1520 Yoshimura AKAMATSU raised an army again and sent Norimoto KODERA to capture eastern Mimasaka Province and 村国 URAGAMI in Mitsuishi-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: Eastern→eastern,浦上村国→村国 URAGAMI と修正しました。スペースを修正しました。

sen.j: 東美作で赤松勢は浦上勢を圧倒したが、能家は踏みとどまった少数の兵を率いて朝駆けを行うなど、離散した兵を糾合し赤松勢と対峙した。
sen.e: The Akamatsu forces overwhelmed the Urakami forces in Eastern Mimasaka Province however, Yoshi-ie rallied those few troops that held their ground and by launching early morning attacks he was able to muster his troops and hold his own with the Akamatsu forces.

The Akamatsu forces overwhelmed the Urakami forces in Eastern Mimasaka Province however, Yoshi-ie rallied those few troops that held their ground and by launching early morning attacks he was able to muster his troops and hold his own with the Akamatsu forces.

The Akamatsu forces overwhelmed the Urakami forces in eastern Mimasaka Province however, Yoshiie rallied those few troops that held their ground and by launching early morning attacks he was able to muster his troops and hold his own with the Akamatsu forces.
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。 Eastern→eastern,Yoshi-ie→Yoshiie と修正しました。

sen.j: さらに村宗は小寺氏の家臣を寝返らせることに成功し、これをもって東美作の赤松勢を敗走させた。
sen.e: In particular, Muramune URAGAMI successfully double-crossed the Kodera clan retainers which resulted in the Akamatsu forces retreating from Eastern Mimasaka Province.
In particular, Muramune URAGAMI successfully double-crossed the Kodera clan retainers which resulted in the Akamatsu forces retreating from Eastern Mimasaka Province.
In particular, Muramune successfully double-crossed the Kodera clan retainers which resulted in the Akamatsu forces retreating from eastern Mimasaka Province.
sen.cmt: URAGAMI を削除しました。Eastern→eastern と修正しました。

sen.j: これらの度重なる敗北により義村の権威は失墜し、逆に村宗の勢力は拡大した。
sen.e: Yoshimura's influence waned as a result of these repeated defeats whereas, Muramune`s power grew.
Yoshimura's influence waned as a result of these repeated defeats whereas, Muramune`s power grew.
Yoshimura's influence waned as a result of these repeated defeats whereas, Muramune's power grew.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィーを修正しました。

sen.j: 遂には播磨国に侵入して西播磨一帯を制圧し、赤松義村を隠居させ幽閉し、後に殺害した（1521年）。
sen.e: Running counter to this was his raids on Harima Province (and control of the west part of the province) whereupon Yoshimura AKAMATSU was made to retire to the confines of his home where later on (1521) Yoshimura was killed.

Running counter to this was his raids on Harima Province (and control of the west part of the province) whereupon Yoshimura AKAMATSU was made to retire to the confines of his home where later on (1521) Yoshimura was killed.

Muramune at last invaded into Harima Province (and control of the west part of the province), whereupon Yoshimura AKAMATSU was forced to retire to the confines of his home where later on (1521) Yoshimura was killed.
sen.cmt: 「遂には・・・侵入して」の部分を修正しました。made→forced と修正しました。

sen.j: ここに浦上氏の下剋上となったのである。
sen.e: This is where the tables were reversed and the Uragami clan (of lowly origins) found themselves ruling the elite.
This is where the tables were reversed and the Uragami clan (of lowly origins) found themselves ruling the elite.
This is where the tables were reversed and the Uragami clan (of lowly origins) found themselves ruling the elite.

sen.j: 大永3年（1523年）、義村の子である赤松晴政（晴政）を擁立した浦上村国と小寺氏（則職か）を討つため、浦上村宗は播磨に出兵した。
sen.e: In 1523 Muramune URAGAMI launched an expedition to Harima Province to attack 浦上村国 and the Kodera clan (possibly Norimoto) who were supporters of Harumasa AKAMATSU (Yoshimura`s son)
In 1523 Muramune URAGAMI launched an expedition to Harima Province to attack 浦上村国 and the Kodera clan (possibly Norimoto) who were supporters of Harumasa AKAMATSU (Yoshimura`s son)
In 1523 Muramune URAGAMI launched an expedition to Harima Province to attack 村国 URAGAMI and the Kodera clan (possibly Norimoto) who were supporters of Harumasa AKAMATSU (Yoshimura's son).
sen.cmt: 浦上村国→村国 URAGAMI と修正しました。アポストロフィーを守勢しました。ピリオドを補いました。

sen.j: しかし先陣を務めた能家の次男宇喜多四郎が、村国の策略にあって討死となった。
sen.e: However Yoshi-ie`s second son Shiro UKITA who was in the advance force was killed in battle when he fell for a ruse by 村国.
However Yoshi-ie`s second son Shiro UKITA who was in the advance force was killed in battle when he fell for a ruse by 村国.
However Yoshiie's second son Shiro UKITA who was in the advance force was killed in battle when he fell for a ruse by 村国.
sen.cmt: Yoshi-ie→Yoshiie と修正しました。アポストロフィーを修正しました。

sen.j: それを知った能家はみずからも死地を求めて敵陣に突撃奮戦し、結果的に浦上軍に勝利をもたらした。
sen.e: Hearing of the death, Yoshi-ie made a point of proceeding to the location where the killing had taken place, engaged the enemy in hard fought battle and was ultimately victorious.
Hearing of the death, Yoshi-ie made a point of proceeding to the location where the killing had taken place, engaged the enemy in hard fought battle and was ultimately victorious.
Hearing of the death, Yoshiie himself made a point of seeking the location to die, engaged the enemy in hard fought battle and was ultimately victorious.
sen.cmt: Yoshi-ie→Yoshiie と修正しました。「みずからも死地を求めて」という部分を修正しました。

sen.j: この能家の奮戦を伝え聞いた管領 細川高国は、名馬一頭と名のある釜を贈ったと伝えている。
sen.e: Hearing of Yoshi-ie`s hard fought battles, the kanrei (shogunal deputy) Takakuni HOSOKAWA sent Yoshi-ie a fine horse and exquisite pot.
Hearing of Yoshi-ie`s hard fought battles, the kanrei (shogunal deputy) Takakuni HOSOKAWA sent Yoshi-ie a fine horse and exquisite pot.
Hearing of Yoshiie's hard fought battles, the kanrei (shogunal deputy) Takakuni HOSOKAWA gifted Yoshiie a fine horse and exquisite iron pot.
sen.cmt: yoshi-ie→Yoshiie,sent→gifted,pot→iron pot と修正しました。アポストロフィーを修正しました。

sen.j: 翌大永4年（1524年）、家督を子の興家に譲り、出家している。
sen.e: In 1524 he passed the control of his family to his son 興家 and then Yoshi-ie became a Buddhist priest.
In 1524 he passed the control of his family to his son 興家 and then Yoshi-ie became a Buddhist priest.
In 1524 he passed the family estate to his son Okiie and then Yoshiie entered the Buddhist priesthood.
sen.cmt: control of his family→family estate,Yoshi-ie→Yoshiie と修正しました。「出家」の部分を修正しました。「興家＝おきいえ」と確認し、修正しました。

sen.j: （1531年ではなくこの時、同時に隠居したとする文献も。）
sen.e: (There are also documents that show it was possibly 1531 that he retired)
(There are also documents that show it was possibly 1531 that he retired)
(There are also documents that show he possibly retired at this time, not in 1531.)
sen.cmt: 原文部分の下のセルに残っていたカッコ部分をこの段に入れ、もとのセルは削除しました。文脈に応じて修正しました。ピリオドを補いました。

sen.j: 享禄4年（1531年）、主君の村宗が大物崩れで細川晴元と三好元長の連合軍に敗れて戦死すると、それを機に砥石城で隠居した。
sen.e: Apparently Yoshi-ie retired to Toishi-jo Castle in 1531 following the death in battle of lord Muramune, when defeated at the Battle of Daimotsu by the combined forces of Harumoto HOSOKAWA and Motonaga MIYOSHI

Apparently Yoshi-ie retired to Toishi-jo Castle in 1531 following the death in battle of lord Muramune, when defeated at the Battle of Daimotsu by the combined forces of Harumoto HOSOKAWA and Motonaga MIYOSHI

sen.cmt: Yoshi-ie→Yoshiie と修正しました。ピリオドを補いました。

sen.j: 天文3年（1534年）、以前から仲の悪かった同じく浦上氏の家臣であり、尾根向かいの長沼荘高取城主島村盛実の奇襲を受け砥石城にて自害した。
sen.e: In 1534 he committed suicide at Takatori-jo Castle following a surprise attack from a ridge by a retainer of the Uragami Clan who had previously been on bad terms.
In 1534 he committed suicide at Takatori-jo Castle following a surprise attack from a ridge by a retainer of the Uragami Clan who had previously been on bad terms.

In 1534 he committed suicide at Toishi-jo Castle following a surprise attack from Morizane SHIMAMURA, ta retainer of the Uragami Clan and the lord of Takatori-jo Castle of Naganuma-sho Manor, a ridge across, who had previously been on bad terms with him.
sen.cmt: Takatori-jo Castle→Toishi-jo Castle（砥石城） と修正しました。スペースを修正しました。文脈より抜けている部分を補い、修正しました。

sen.j: （この後、砥石城は浮田国定が領有したことから浮田氏の内訌とも、上意討ちとも諸説あり）法名は常玖、または常珍。
sen.e: (Subsequently, after Takatori-jo Castle came into the possession of Kunitada UKITA discord erupted within the Ukita clan and rumors of a decree to kill malcontents) his Buddhist posthumous name being 常玖 or 常珍,
sen.cmt: I do not see the logical link between the contents of the bracket and the bit outside the bracket…

sen.cmt: Takatori-jo Castle→Toishi-jo Castle と修正しました。「常玖」、「常珍」の読みはそれぞれ確認出来ておりません。スペース、ピリオドの修正をしました。

sen.j: 興家は暗愚な人物だったと（またはその振りをしていたとも）言われ、砥石城落城の際は6歳になる直家を連れて落ち延びた。
sen.e: Apparently 興家 was a feeble minded person (or behaved as such) and escaped with the 6 year old Naoie when Toishi-jo Castle was about to surrender.
Apparently 興家 was a feeble minded person (or behaved as such) and escaped with the 6 year old Naoie when Toishi-jo Castle was about to surrender.
Apparently Okiie was a feeble minded person (or pretended as such) and escaped with the six year old Naoie when Toishi-jo Castle was about to surrender.
sen.cmt: 興家→Okiie,behaved→pretended,6→six と修正しました。スペースを修正しました。

sen.j: 宇喜多氏の再興が図られるのは、孫の直家の代になってからである。
sen.e: A revival of the fortunes of the Ukita Clan were planned during the time of the grandson Naoie.

sen.j: なお、大永4年（1524年）に京都南禅寺の僧・九峰宗成に描かせた能家の肖像画が岡山県立博物館に所蔵されており、県の重要文化財に指定されている。
sen.e: Furthermore, a 1524 portrait that was painted of Yoshi-ie as the Buddhist priest 九峰宗成 of Nanzen-ji Temple in Kyoto is part of the Okayama Prefectural Museum collection and designated as an Important Cultural Asset of the prefecture.
